revised_title: The Rate of Production of Helium from Radium: A Further Investigation
tldr: The author investigates the rate of helium production from radium using a McLeod gauge and a series of experiments. The results show a steady growth of pressure, with a maintained increment of approximately 0.37 cubic millimeters of gas per gram of radium per day. The author also explores the possibility of helium occlusion in the cooled charcoal and surrounding glass.
